meanings.definition: A rocky promontory or headland jutting into the sea.
meanings.sent1: The skaw stood tall against the crashing waves.
meanings.sent2: We climbed to the top of the skaw to see the ocean view.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the skaw, enjoying the salty breeze.
meanings.sent4: The skaw loomed like a giant guardian of the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The skaw's rugged edges were a challenge to navigate.

meanings.definition: To turn or veer suddenly off course.
meanings.sent1: The car skawed to avoid hitting the animal on the road.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to skaw while riding your bike on the gravel.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder skawed unexpectedly, causing a funny tumble.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts skawed towards happier memories.
meanings.sent5: The wind skawed the leaves in all directions.

meanings.definition: A sudden change in direction or course.
meanings.sent1: The skaw in the river caught us by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The skier made a sharp skaw to avoid a collision.
meanings.sent3: The skaw in the conversation led to an unexpected revelation.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job was a major skaw in his life.
meanings.sent5: The storm's sudden skaw left a trail of destruction.
